header.title: COLLECTED ONLINE WORKS OF ROBERT BRUCE AS OF FEBRUARY 2007
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Bioenergetic Development, Astral Projection, Psychic Self-Defense, Healing

central_thesis: Robert Bruce's collected works present a practical, experiential, and non-dogmatic system for bioenergetic and spiritual development, primarily focused on achieving conscious Out-of-Body Experiences (OBE), developing psychic abilities, and implementing psychic self-defense. The core philosophy emphasizes firsthand experience over inherited belief systems and introduces original theories like the 'Mind-Split Effect' and the 'NEW Energy Ways' system for direct energy body manipulation.

structure_content.summary: An introduction to Robert Bruce as an internationally respected mystic, metaphysical researcher, and experimenter. It highlights his 30+ years of exploring paranormal mechanics, energetics, and dynamics, covering OBEs, the human energy body, energy work, clairvoyance, healing, and psychic self-defense. He is noted as a 'Metaphysicist' who began public workshops in 2003 and authored several best-selling books.

This treatise, a rewritten and updated version from 1994, details the fundamental concepts of astral projection. Part 1 defines the astral dimension, its composition as 'mind stuff,' and the nature of thought forms and dreams. It introduces 'Spherical Vision' and the 'Alice In Wonderland Effect,' explaining perceptual distortions. Part 2 explains how projection happens during sleep, differentiates between OBE, astral projection, and lucid dreaming, and discusses the role of etheric matter and chakras. It also explores higher dimensional levels (Mental, Buddhic, Atmic) and the Akashic Records. Parts 3-6 outline practical projection training, emphasizing relaxation, concentration, trance induction (mental falling), chakra stimulation, and the 'ROPE Technique' for conscious exit. It covers OBE memory recall, common projection problems (e.g., being 'stuck'), and various travel methods (surface, instantaneous, long-distance, orbiting). It also introduces the 'Future Wind' phenomenon and symbolic visions, with advice on interpretation.

Introduces the 'NEW Energy Ways' system, a bioenergetic development method based on 'Tactile Imaging' (T.I.). Chapter 1 describes the energy body's structure, including Master, Storage, Primary (Major Chakras), Secondary (Minor Chakras), and Tertiary (Energy Exchange Ports) circuits, emphasizing their interdependence. Chapter 2 criticizes visualization-based techniques, asserting that T.I. is superior and universally accessible for energy manipulation. Subsequent chapters provide detailed T.I. exercises for stimulating energy centers and pathways in the feet, legs, hands, and arms, with caution regarding sensitive areas like groin centers. Chapters on 'Energy Bounce Techniques' and 'Energy Raising & Storage' explain methods to increase energy flow and store it in the Sub-Navel center, linking to improved vitality and self-healing. 'Energy & The Immune System' discusses how NEW enhances physical health and combats illness, with case histories for diabetes and cancer.

Categorizes non-physical entities encountered in the astral dimension, from positive (demigods, angels, spirit masters) to negative ('Astral Wildlife,' 'Negs'). It describes their varied intelligence, forms (often illusory), and interactions with projectors. Guidelines for safe interaction are provided, emphasizing politeness, avoiding interference, and being prepared to retreat from threatening entities.

Describes astral 'hospital' scenarios for recently deceased spirits, which Bruce perceives as mind-created interpretations of healing energy fields. It discusses how spirits often have vague memories of their earthly life and afterlife, highlighting memory translation problems for both spirits and healers. The concept of spirits being 'too far away from their natural, base-level of consciousness' is proposed to explain surreal experiences and memory issues.

Explores out-of-body sexual encounters as a 'human-nature complication of consciousness and bioenergetic incarnation.' It differentiates between 'real time sex' (more intense, instantaneous orgasm, involves physical body feedback) and 'astral sex' (slower, less intense, more like physical sex). It notes that sexual thoughts can negatively impact OBEs and discusses how projectors' self-awareness shapes their projected double's image. Methods for avoiding unwanted sexual encounters and the impact of 'disreputable sexual behavior' on a projector's dimensional level are also discussed.

Challenges the popular belief in 'astral police' or higher authorities grounding projectors for unethical behavior. Bruce argues that natural barriers and energetic repercussions (e.g., lowering of energetic values, attracting negative entities) are the true deterrents. It emphasizes personal judgment and conscience in OBE activities and advises against deliberate privacy invasion, as this attracts like-minded negative entities. The historical context of Victorian moral fallacies influencing New Age beliefs is also addressed.

A collection of personal accounts from volunteers illustrating various OBE phenomena, energy sensations, and self-healing experiences with the NEW system. Cases include waking paralysis, spontaneous projections, energy surges, blockages, healing of colds/influenza, high-risk pregnancy improvement, and the detection of energy by Reiki healers. These histories serve to validate Bruce's theories and techniques experientially.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Nature of The Mind-Split Effect
structure_content.summary: A detailed explanation of Bruce's 'Mind-Split Theory,' which posits that during OBEs, consciousness splits into multiple copies, one remaining in the physical body and others inhabiting subtle bodies. This refutes the 'Empty Body Theory' and explains how memories are recorded, lost, or overwritten during reintegration. It delves into the implications of this duality for understanding consciousness, spiritual evolution, and the nature of reality, emphasizing that the projected double is an extension of 'the real you'.

Critiques traditional New Age spiritual models, particularly concerning good and evil, Karma, and possession, arguing that they are oversimplified and often contradicted by firsthand experience. Bruce uses his own experiences with psychic attacks and spirit entities to challenge the notion that evil spirits are mere hallucinations or that children are immune to attacks. He advocates for a belief system built on personal experience, logic, and self-discipline, rejecting dogmatic views that hinder understanding.

structure_content.chapter_title: Is there an afterlife and what happens?
structure_content.summary: Bruce shares his perspective on the afterlife, based on seeing deceased people. He proposes that spirits process past lives in the 'real time zone' before merging into collective consciousness and being reborn. He introduces the concept of 'Eternal NOW' where all lives are lived simultaneously, making linear reincarnation a 'diplomatic' explanation. The possibility of transcending reincarnation through Kundalini development into a 'light body' is also discussed, along with the human ability to forget painful memories.

Provides a comprehensive overview of various spirit types, from good (angels, spirit masters) to bad (demons, Negs, astral wildlife). It discusses their interactions with humans, the role of Karma and Universal Law in shaping life experiences, and the importance of 'Right Thinking and Right Action.' It critiques modern religious beliefs for downplaying evil and emphasizes the need for spiritual strength and maturity to withstand negative influences. Angelic interventions are described as rare and tied to specific destinies, not simple requests.

Describes Robert Bruce's personal methodology for building a belief system based on verifiable personal experience rather than dogma. After dismantling his flawed belief system, he used a 'catch basket' approach of pondering unanswered questions during meditation and pre-sleep to receive 'inspirational ideas' and 'sparkling clues' from his higher-self. This process allowed him to develop practical truths and knowledge, emphasizing experiential validation for spiritual progress.

Details changes in the human aura prior to and during death, based on Bruce's observations as a mystic and healer. It describes the etheric aura fading and then expanding into a 'peculiar bright ethereal glow' with millions of white and silver sparks a few days before death. This ethereal expansion is linked to clairvoyance and temporarily uplifts dying persons. The time distortion and 'unseen light' phenomena at the moment of death are also discussed, leading to the spirit's swift departure and the rapid implosion of the ethereal aura.

A collection of short, philosophical reflections and aphorisms on spiritual truths, life lessons, self-knowledge, the nature of God, happiness, suffering, and the path to enlightenment. These fragments encourage critical thinking, personal experience, and self-discipline over dogma and external validation.

A collection of poems ('Rope,' 'Shadowfall,' 'Heart Sounds,' 'Mushrooms,' 'Timeless Tales,' 'Ode To An Editor') that reflect on spiritual themes, life's struggles, the nature of humanity, and personal experiences with pain, loss, and the quest for meaning. 'Shadowfall' is particularly noted as being penned after the death of his firstborn.

Addresses common questions on astral projection, energy work, psychic self-defense, and spiritual development. Topics include: avoiding waking paralysis, astral multiple personality disorder, possession during OBEs, energy affecting physical objects, using Chi/Reiki for self-defense, defending against psychic attacks from family, developing precognition/intuition, neg hierarchies, OBE requirements, energy body damage/repair, fixing spirit manifestations, long-distance ET communication, multiple reincarnations in non-linear time, negs attacking other negs, new copies of consciousness during mind split, OBE altered states/technological advances, OBE exit positions, overcoming fear of OBE, positive spirit entities, psychic attack from family, psychic defense for others, realizing non-attachment, reforming negative entities, spirits affecting inanimate objects, effectiveness of charms/talismans, the God field, truth or diplomacy, visualization problems during core image work, why can't I have another OBE, and why do negs attack humans. Practical advice and theoretical explanations are provided for each question.

key_concepts.definition: The closest dimension to the physical, overlaying and permeating the world like a vast 'mind net.' It is composed of 'mind stuff' that is highly sensitive to thought, forming 'astral planes,' 'astral worlds,' or 'astral realms' based on collective consciousness. It contains thoughts, memories, fantasies, and dreams.

A real-time projection close to the physical world, often occurring during near-death experiences or consciously induced. It is characterized by awareness of physical reality in real time due to the astral body containing a significant amount of etheric matter.

Becoming fully aware that one is dreaming during a dream and gaining conscious control over the dream state. It is similar to astral projection, but time and reality are distorted, unlike real-time OBEs.

The vitality sheath, a dense layer of pale smoke-like energy clinging to the skin, visible with auric sight. It expands during sleep to absorb and store vital energy and contracts when awake. It is the first subtle body level, closely enmeshed with the physical body.

Non-physical energy organs that transform raw subtle energy into more refined, usable forms. There are 7 major (Primary) and over 300 minor (Secondary) chakras, with Tertiary Energy Exchange Ports. They are crucial for energy flow, psychic abilities, and spiritual development. Locations include Base, Spleen, Solar Plexus, Heart, Throat, Brow, and Crown.

A bioenergetic development system based on 'Tactile Imaging' (T.I.). It focuses on stimulating secondary and tertiary energy centers using focused body awareness actions to move energy, thereby increasing life energy flow, clearing blockages, and accelerating psychic/spiritual development without relying on visualization.

The active use of body awareness to directly stimulate and manipulate the energy body in a controlled, non-visual way. It involves 'feeling' specific areas and performing repetitive awareness actions (stirring, brushing, wrapping, tearing, sponging) as if physically touching or manipulating the area from within.

A dynamic OBE projection method involving imagining an invisible 'ROPE' hanging from the ceiling and 'climbing' it hand over hand with imaginary hands. This action exerts direct, single-point pressure on the astral body, forcing separation and inducing the trance state, chakra opening, and vibrations, leading to conscious exit.

A new OBE technique that involves repeatedly shifting one's point of awareness from the physical body to a target (e.g., on the ceiling) and back, for one-second intervals. This rhythmic action helps to 'loosen up' the projectable double and trigger the projection reflex, serving as a preparatory exercise or alternative to ROPE.

The phenomenon during OBE or sleep where consciousness splits into multiple, identical copies: one remaining in the physical body (original hard copy) and others reflecting into extruded subtle bodies. These copies can think and act independently, affecting memory retention and dual perceptions during projections. It forms the underlying principle of incarnation.

Found in the buffer zone between the astral and mental worlds, these are an infinite mental history record of every thought and event, including probabilities of future events. Accessing them clairvoyantly often reveals symbolic representations, which require skill and knowledge to interpret.

Karma is the accumulated influential force from past conscious acts, guiding a spirit's experiences for spiritual progression. Universal Law is the working mechanism of Karma, applying preset attractions and repulsions to life experiences. Both positive and negative forces are necessary for spiritual balance and growth.

Low-order astral wildlife or negative spirit entities that prey on living beings' vital life energy. They are often depicted as small, horned demons causing jabbing sensations. They typically operate in darkness and quiet, and are characterized by inflexibility and an inability to adapt to countermeasures. They play a role in natural selection and spiritual evolution by providing resistance.

A self-healing technique within the NEW system, used to concentrate the body's natural healing energies in damaged or diseased areas. It involves imagining an 'endless white bandage of pure energy' flowing from awareness hands into the affected area, aiding in clearing blockages and restoring energy.

A technique to break negative attachments by unearthing and 'destroying' mental 'core images' (traumatic memories or implanted fantasies) in the mind's eye. These images are seen as roots or circuit boards, which are 'attacked' with imaginary weapons (e.g., sword, flamethrower) to sever energetic links.

The occult principle that 'energy flows where your attention goes.' Negative entities instinctively solicit psychic connections with victims by stimulating primal responses like fear or sex to gain attention and feed on energy. Counteracting this involves shifting attention to mundane, positive things and applying countermeasures.

Bruce's conceptualization of God as a universal frequency of consciousness that permeates everything and exists everywhere, including within each individual. The 'Eternal NOW' refers to the highest dimensional level where time ceases to exist, and past, present, and future occur simultaneously, with all consciousness being part of this ONE source.

practical_system.description: Robert Bruce's practical system integrates bioenergetic development, OBE techniques, and psychic self-defense through a hands-on, experiential approach. The core is the 'NEW Energy Ways' system, which uses 'Tactile Imaging'—a non-visual, feeling-based method—to stimulate the energy body's numerous centers and pathways. This increases energy flow, leading to enhanced psychic abilities, self-healing, and conscious OBEs. The system also includes specific methods like the 'ROPE Technique' and 'YOYO Technique' for inducing projections and a robust set of 'Countermeasures & Wards' for protection against negative entities and psychic attacks, emphasizing that all knowledge should be based on personal experience.

Imaginary weapons (sword, torch, baseball bat, rocket launcher, laser gun, flamethrower for Core Image Removal).

Breath awareness meditation (focus on breath, push away intruding thoughts).
Mental falling exercise (imagine falling to induce trance state).
Energy raising and chakra stimulation (using imaginary HANDS and awareness actions like stirring, brushing, wrapping, tearing, sponging on chakras and energy exchange ports).

Food Energy Awareness (consciously absorb life force from food and drink).
Crowd & Excitement Energy (draw emotional energy from excited crowds into Sub-Navel center).
Wind Energy (draw wind energy through hands into Sub-Navel, combined with energy breathing).

critical_analysis.relevance: Robert Bruce's work is highly relevant in contemporary esotericism due to its emphasis on practical, accessible methods for energy work and OBE, bridging traditional Eastern concepts with Western understanding. His 'NEW Energy Ways' system is particularly innovative for its non-visual, tactile approach, making spiritual development achievable for individuals who struggle with traditional visualization. The 'Mind-Split Theory' offers a coherent metaphysical framework for understanding OBEs, consciousness, and the afterlife, challenging prevalent 'empty body' theories and New Age dogmas by prioritizing experiential evidence. The practical psychic self-defense methods provide essential tools for navigating the often-overlooked negative aspects of the subtle dimensions, filling a critical gap in much modern spiritual literature. His work promotes self-reliance and critical thinking in spiritual pursuit.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience for Robert Bruce's collected works includes complete novices interested in spiritual and psychic development, as well as intermediate and advanced practitioners in energy work, astral projection, and metaphysics. It is particularly valuable for those who have struggled with traditional visualization techniques, individuals seeking practical self-healing methods, and anyone concerned with psychic self-defense or understanding spirit entities. The clear, step-by-step instructions and emphasis on personal experience make it suitable for self-study, while the advanced theories provide depth for seasoned explorers of consciousness.
